definition: no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: The doctor there, announced MiaoQing the facts of death.
sentences.chinese: 醫生無計可施，宣佈苗青死亡的事實。

sentences.english: Not even the best doctor in the country could cure her.
sentences.chinese: 大家都無計可施，全國最好的良醫也沒辦法救她的病。

sentences.english: To say that we can't do anything about America's drug problem is a cop-out .
sentences.chinese: 說我們對美國的毒品問題無計可施是在逃避責任。

sentences.english: Fortunately, there is a workaround to this problem.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，對這個問題並非無計可施。

definition: to remain unmoved
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
reparations/to pay reparations
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
penniless (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
to be transferred to another post/to post away
false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
